Reviews.Author: Sandra L. Brown "Sandra"
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with our new LG 42LD450.  This is our third LG TV and we are thrilled with all three.  The quality can't be matched for this price.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from 27" LCD
Reviews.Author: Robert Findlay
Reviews.Content: Amazon had an amazing price (still going on 11/20/2010 - 11/28/2010) on this unit.  Crystal clear quality, simply amazing for gaming.  Side ports are easy to locate.  Base of TV swivels removing some of the pros of having it wall mounted.  Easy to install - all you need is a screw driver.Sharp images, great, loud speakers.  I put this TV in my bed room and it is a lot larger than I expected.  I highly suggest this over a 32", the extra 100-200 $ IS worth it.Mostly just wanted to give this a 5 star review, it's a TV at a price that fully deserves it.

Reviews.Title: Sit dead center or else
Reviews.Author: Uncle Stan "Uncle Stan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the LG 42LD450 at a chain store but want to caution Amazon customers. I was impressed with the specifications for the price and have had the set for almost two weeks. I tried everything I could think of to get some enjoyment out of it but am just plain disappointed.As another reviewer points out, you need to be directly in front of this set to appreciate the vibrant color and crisp picture. Get as little as 30 degrees off axis up, down, or sideways and you'll find yourself reaching for the remote to tweak the color. Graduated blacks such as shadows turn a ghastly mossy green. I am also unhappy with the fact that the backlight is very uneven, falling off dramatically at the edges. The dynamic color and contrast controls are not subtle in the least. They are slow to respond to changes in lighting conditions and adjustments are very noticeable. For the most part, solid blocks of color like those in cartoons look fantastic, but depictions of reality leave a bit to be desired.I believe the unit I purchased is defective as one side of the picture is slightly washed out and blurry with some vertical non-linearity. It's getting progressively worse.The sound is disappointing with almost no low end. The automatic gain that is supposed to adjust levels between programs and commercials is so annoyingly bad at the task that I just turned it off.Score points for easy set up and the ability to plug in a USB flash drive full of music or photos.

Reviews.Title: LG 42LD450 42-INCH
Reviews.Author: mattc
Reviews.Content: I just got this 42" LCD and loving it. For the price and the convenience of getting it delivered at your door is incomparable. Quality of picture is very crisp and clear comparing to other top brands.

Reviews.Title: Research Pays Off
Reviews.Author: marqb6709
Reviews.Content: Pros:Price - I haven't seen another sub $500 42" namebrand tv with free shipping (deal when I bought it before Thanksgiving)Content - looks good, slight 'ghosting' on fast motion but barely noticable to meChannels - Auto seek sets up all the channels from cable and over the air, so I get some HD OTA channels now instead of SD of the same channels on cableSetup - Guided menu on setup of tv picture the first time its powered onRemote - Very simple but does everything needed, easy to get around useCons (Kind of):HDMI - Only 2, I use one for PC and if I get a game console then they are both filled. Knew this before I bought itSound - The only sound output on the TV is optical.  This works for me because I have an old reciever that doesn't even have HDMI on it but extra cable to buy/useSound - There is no way to control the volume of the optical output so every time I change the volume I have to grab the reciever remoteMenu - There seems to be a simple menu and a more complex menu, slightly confusing. Not terrible thoughFor anyone on a budget looking for an entry level LCD this is it.  Right now the viewing distance is about 7'-10', the tv doesn't emerse me like a 50+" but I'm also not going to pay the extra $300 for that at this point in time.  It's the same song and dance with LED, it'd be great but not my price range.

Reviews.Title: B-E-A-Utiful!!!
Reviews.Author: AA@CalU
Reviews.Content: This TV is perfect.  I see no delay or ghosts as some worry about with it being only 60 Hz.  The picture is perfect with bright and vibrant colors, from any angle of the room.  There are only a couple HDMI ports but that's all that I really need anyway.  Regardless, I got this TV at a great price right before black friday at the same price as the "door-buster" for this TV at Best Buy.  I purchased from the comfort of my own couch and had it delivered on Black Friday.  Easy to set-up; had it up and running in about 15 minutes after delivery.  I am SO happy with the value of this purchase for such a QUALITY LG.  I will likely stick with LG from here on out, and also likely stick with amazon and their great deals and value shipping!  You want a great TV at a good price, this is your TV.  BUY it and you WILL NOT be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: Good TV at an exceptionally good price
Reviews.Author: S. Harrison
Reviews.Content: The wife and I purchased this TV from Amazon Friday Morning (11/26), right at the height of the Black Friday frenzy. Walmart had the 42LD400 model as one of their doorbusters, but my wife wasn't one of the fortunate ones. Came home and checked online,... surprised to discover Amazon was selling the 42LD450 model for the same price. What?!?!? I don't think a 60 tic-tocs passed before I had it in my Amazon cart and pounded on the confirm order button. Turns out we got the better model for less money, as I paid no sales taxes and their speedy 2 day shipping was free. That's $478.00 shipped. I believe this price only lasted for several hours,... by the time I passed this info on to another family member, the price had gone up 50 bucks just that quickly.The picture quality on the 42LD450 is very good, way better than some of the sets we were looking at in stores for $100+ more. The audio is acceptable, but that's of little matter to us as we will be pumping that through an external 5.1 audio-video receiver. There's been some discussion in here about how behind the 60Hz units are, well if you really do your research, you find that many of 120Hz sets do not have the processing horsepower to do the smoothing technology any justice and end up doing more visual harm that good. Plus, LD was kind enough to fit this model with one of the better LCD panels which is fast enough to process movement at 60Hz without the aid of smoothing gimicks. If you have the opportunity to do so, just check the box of the unit you're about to purchase, the full model nomenclature will be printed on the top and bottom,... ex. 42LD450-UA.CUSWLH. If the 4th letter in the last alpha string is a 'W', then you have the better S-IPS LCD panel which will handle motion and judder quite nicely without 120Hz and 240Hz tricks. If the 4th letter in this string is an 'I', then you are about to purchase the most sought after set with the best 42" LCD panel available,... the IPS alpha panel. According to many pro reviews I've read on this set, these panels do better at 60HZ than entry level models (which the LD450 is) equipped with the lesser panels sporting 120Hz and 240Hz smoothing gadgets. The point is, anything beyond 60HZ (50HZ in Europe) amounts to nothing less than electronic image guessing on the part of the TV. Apparently it's cheaper to use guessing technology than to just employ the use of a top notch and speedy LCD panel from the start. The companies do a remarkable marketing job to confuse and impression folks like Heather. I will concede however, that the upper model lines do employ a more robust smoothing engine with ample processing horsepower on board to do the technology justice, but then we're talking about the XXLD550, the XXLD6XX and XXLD7XX models, as well as LG's Infinia line. In this respect, the LD520 have more in common with our LD450's than it does with the LD550,... the LD520 is the poster child for coming to the party with 120Hz smoothing and not enough horsepower to run it properly. But that's marketing for you, isn't it Heather? And keep in mind, the more image guessing you ask the TV to do (120HZ vs 240z), the more processing horsepower is needed for those guesses to be intelligent guesses. Bottom line,... poor guessing looks worst to our eyes than no guessing at all. Faster high quality LCD panels coupled with decent pulldown engines makes the need for guessing almost academic. 120Hz is like having a conversation with someone, and trying to finish each and every one of their sentences before they reach the halfway point in each sentence. 240Hz is like have the same conversation with the same person, but trying to finish each and every one of their sentences before they right at the point where they reach the 1/4 mark of each sentence. What a mess, unless you're psychic!The viewing angle on this set seems to differ depending on which LCD panel your set is blessed with. The IPS panel is said to be not as good with viewing from angles as the others. Personally, the side-to-side angel is just fine for me, but I do see some wash when viewing from below. For this reason, we may not wall mount this unit. I'm also wishing there were more than 2 HDMI ports. But all in all, this set is about the best out there at the price I paid for it, even at in it's more natural range of $549 - $599. Anything above that, I think the Samsung LN40C630 is a better option,... but only better than the LD450. Above the 600 mark, there's the 42LD550, which many believe competes very well against the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: If you need a new TV and want to upgrade to HD, make the jump!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Johnston "lovingreen"
Reviews.Content: Okay if you are anything like me before a purchase of more than $50 bucks you spend hours and hours of research on what item you should buy- and compare quality vs price. Honestly even though the internet has opened up a whole new world, allowing consumers to research reviews and prices without leaving your door, it can be overwhelming. I previously had an analog TV- big bulky Sony 32". To me it was the perfect size (at least the screen) minus the quality. I do not pay for cable so once the local stations all switched to HD things weren't always up to par on my analog. It finally died and I had to decide on a new TV.Of course this was now the time to do real research on HD- should I go with LCD, plasma, or LED. With my extensive research I decided on LCD- plasma seemed to have better blacks but also came with extreme sensitivity and some major problems, LED was new and a great concept but overall it has not been tweeked enough for the color to excel. So I decide get LCD and wait on the LED for next time (which will hopefully be in 10 years, haha).Next to decide was 60 hz or spend the extra $$ for 120 hz. After again extensive research I decided the 120 hz would not be of any use for me only because the blue ray DVD player (ps3) I had would not be able to transmit anything beyond 60 hz. So even if I bought a TV with 120 hz I wouldn't be using it, I would still only be using 60 hz. So if you have a blue ray DVD player or cable/satellite find out what it's capabillities are or if you are willing to spend more to upgrade those also. It mostly effects sports, and I am a football fan but I have seen no issues with the 60 hz.The next and biggest issue of them all, which manufacturer and which model? At first I was set on getting another Sony television but after reading millions of reviews a lot of consumers noted that Sony just wasn't making quality televisions like they used to. Sony has some software issues, which can be solved by updating your TV often and Samsung (leading HD television manufacturer) has some seriously hardware problems. After looking through the reviews the consenus seemed that with Samsung it was either hit or miss. They purchase the glass from (2) different places, depending on which one they used for your TV you might get that high quality TV or you might get the one the breaks down right away. This to me was not worth it. Still a little set on Sony I looked into LG since I had believed they had pretty good quality products. This television was very highly rated overall. I loved how the LG was about $150 cheaper than the Sony. I also looked at inputs. I needed something for my VCR and for my blue ray. Sony did not had a port for the VCR which concerned me. Honestly my kids still watch the old movies I had as a kid. So make sure to figure out what kind of inputs you need and make sure the TV you buy has them!Well to state the obvious I picked the LG over the Sony. I have had the TV for a few months now and have had no problems. The delivery was great. Setup was fairly easy- you do screw the TV on the stand but I love that it is so stable. It has gripping feet so it cannot slide around on the entertainment stand. The quality is good when I use a quality imput- blue ray or HD movies. You will notice the bad quality in older movies (VHS- yes I still use it!) and normal broadcasts not in HD.Okay so my last and final statement- if you are like me, so worried about being ripped off that you will do endless hours of research I hope this saves you some time. I needed a good TV that would work- and this LG did the job at a good price. Just make the jump for it! And remember to get an HD cable (amazon has them cheap) and I would recommend getting HD cable or satellite in order to really see what the TV is capable of.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: Jamie M. Babcock "Voraciousreader"
Reviews.Content: This LCD is never going to be my 54" Panasonic plasma I own at home, coupled with our fantastic surround sound system. However, since we've had to move to my Grandmothers to help her out, it became clear we needed to upgrade from a decade old 27" tube television.  Buying another 56" plasma was completely out of our price range. That being said, I began my search about a month ago, found this deal on Amazon, read the reviews, and looked at it at my local Walmart because I wanted to psychically "see" this before I purchased it.  Walmart had this same exact set for $50.00 more plus whatever sales tax, so I ordered it from Amazon, took advantage of the free shipping and I am thrilled to see what a great set it is.As to the shipping: Fast, easy service; tracking number was sent to me via email, and the delivery date and time was sent to my phone as well via text.  I knew in advance it was coming, which came in handy since this was a gift from "Santa".  No issues with FedEx.Set up: No issues. I lifted this easily out of the box by sliding it on it's side on the floor, with the protective packing still on the screen, put the stand on carefully with my handy screwdriver and was able to put it up on my console by myself since it's extremely light. Once you get the stand on, it's all plug and play right from the box to the console.  It has a USB port for your devices, 1 HDMI, two AV inputs, (which was handy for my Bluray player and my new Wii) right on the back, easy peasy, and then I was onto the setup screen for my DVR/Cable box.  Does it all for you.Settings on the TV: Easy setup with the Picture Wizard and I would highly recommend setting this to your preferences, which are saved for you.  The only complaint I have is if you don't have HD cable, it will look a bit blurry on some channels, and some of the coloring is certainly not realistic, but if you play around with the settings and you're patient, you can get it just right for your particular room.  Our living room is surrounded by floor to ceiling sliding glass doors and windows, so we get a ton of sun in the room; there are constant adjustments I make depending on the hour of the day, but it's very user friendly.Ghosting...honestly, I can't tell any difference between this and my fantastic Panasonic plasma screen. In this case, 60Hz seems to do just fine for watching TV and we set up our Wii today and I've not seen any issues there either.  It might be different with our PS3, but we'll see about that.Complaints: Few;* The stand isn't great for this TV and I would like to see LG make them much more substantial or at least make them longer and slightly wider so you don't fret about it falling forward. It's cheapy black plastic resin that attracts dust right from the box.  I guess if you mount it, it becomes a non issue.* No screen saver when you pause the TV for any length like my Panasonic.  At least I know if I pause and walk away from my plasma, the screen saver will take over and I won't have to worry about my screen taking on an image of Bill O'Reilly permanently.* You have to be QUICK on that input button and make your choice or it bounces you out to "no signal".  It's annoying when you're trying to remember what input you need, however, I've not explored whether you can name your devices or not. That would be fantastic wouldn't it?* Audio. As with all these LCD/LED/Plasma sets, once you've had a surround sound system deliver, you can't go back to watching movies relying on just the sets speakers themselves.  Though, the nice thing about this set is it does have a decent sound delivery for just watching T.V., so that will work for now.Other than those few slight criticisms, this is a great set, worked the first time out, and I am just thrilled at the total difference between the old gray workhorse tube TV and this widescreen wonder.  The set itself is very aesthetically pleasing, shiny black, clean lined widescreen TV. Thin, light and fantastic considering last week I was thinking about buying a nice set of binoculars to see the ticker on the bottom of my 27"!**Also, based on a horrific past experience with a Philips 52" LCD, I bought a 3 year extended warranty off Amazon as well.  You can see my review of that fiasco under my other reviews.  Never, ever again...LG does put out a great product, and one day, this will be a great master bedroom TV for us.  In the meantime, we have a great many movies and lots of Wii to enjoy all because of a great Christmas price on this!  Happy viewing!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic deal
Reviews.Author: Rebekah
Reviews.Content: The in-laws offered to buy us a new TV this holiday season and after some searching we landed on this one.Ordered it with 1-day shipping on a Friday (Amazon's price was a shade under five hundred). At 1pm Saturday the TV was sitting in our living room. It took about 20 minutes to unpack it and set it up (the base was a little tricky to attach, but literally 20 minutes from opening the box to being able to sit down and watch).The TV is gorgeous. Other reviewers had mentioned you have to watch it head-on, but I was able to watch this from the floor, from an extreme side angle, and from above with no problems at all --still a beautiful, crisp image. I was also unable to see a difference between this display and the 120 hz ones I've seen.The sound isn't going to blow you away, but it is more than I would have expected from built-in speakers: loud, clear, and delivers equally well from high to low.I am currently using the TV with a DVD player, Wii, and Roku. HD delivers gorgeously over an Amazon Basics HDMI cable from the Roku, DVDs and Wii both show up great. Bottom line -- if you are looking for a great TV at a fantastic price and aren't worried about a lot of extras, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Good Tv for the Price
Reviews.Author: BeerKing
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV during the Black Friday Sale. The TV quality is good. It is one of the best considersing the size of the tv and its competitors. The Sound quality from is the TV is not as bad as some of the other reviews. It has decent controls and settings although there are some menus that can be confusing. It has a lot of Pros like good picture quality 1080p looks great for a 42 inch TV. (Better than the 40 inch Samsung Tv I have.) Connection to home theater system and gaming consoles was straight forward and easy. The cool feature about the LG is that when you press the input button to change inputs for the TV, it displays only the inputs that are connected to the TV and the ones that are not connected is not accessible, so there is no selection of the wrong input. Tons of pre installed settings for your picture mode, clarity etc. There is also custom picture modes which you can set and save.My only gripes are that it has only 2 hdmi inputs, luckily I have a HDMI splitter so not a big issue.The other major gripe is that when I turn on the floorlamps in the TV room, the lights reflect off the TV and is very annoying to watch a movie or play games with the light on. I have to turn off the lights to watch the screen or change the picture setiing to sports or dynamic mode to see the screen clearly.Overall very Hapy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: A great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Garrett
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome.  42 inches of true beauty and the picture is crisp and clear.  The only problem I have with the picture is the 60 hz. It does make the picture lag sometimes when your watching sports, but it's nothing to major.  The picture looks awesome overall especially for video games and movies. If you can afford the 120 hz then go ahead and get it, but if your not big into sports then this is the TV for you. The viewing from any angle looks good on this tv and setting up the TV is as easy as watching TV. LG made a great TV at an affordable price.  Even though it may not be as good as Samsung TVs, I will definately say its an easy second best along with Panasonic TVs.  I had a vizio before this TV and I could tell right away this is a way better product just by the material and when I had it setup it was clear vizio tvs can not compete with LG.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Value!
Reviews.Author: Mardel Rick
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my husband's elderly parents.  Before shopping online, we actually investigated this TV in a local store, so we got to hear and see it in action.  Compared to other sets in this class, we found it to be the best value for the money.  Amazon's price was about $170 cheaper than in any store in our area.  With the super saver shipping, deciding to order it from them was a "no-brainer."  The set arrived in just a few days and everything was in good shape.  Setting the tv up was quick and easy.  The picture is crystal clear and the colors are very natural.  The factory presets were perfect, so we didn't have to adjust the picture at all.  The remote has good-sized buttons and the menu's on-screen display is large, simple, and easy to read.  The sound is strong and clear.  Voices are easy to understand, especially with the clear voice feature.  The ease of use, great display, and terrific sound will be appreciated by anyone, but are perfect for elderly people (even the hearing-impaired).  We are very happy with this purchase, as are the couple who received it as a gift.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the money! Beautful Picture!!
Reviews.Author: John Davis
Reviews.Content: I spent close to a month looking at different tv's and doing countless hours of research because I only wanted to have to do it once.  I finally settled on this LG and reading over 200 reviews and going to the store to compare the picture myself with the other options.The picture is truely amazing.  Right out of the box the picture was perfect.  I used the picture wizard and couldn't be happier with it.  I was a little nervous about not getting a 120hz television since I spend alot of time watching football and basketball.  I have had any problems with blurring. If you really concentrate and look for a blur your going to find it, but if your doing that your not watching the game your just looking for something to complain about.The number of hdmi inputs could be a limiting factor for some, it wasn't for me since I knew I would only need 2, one for our dish network reciever and one for a blue ray player.  We have not watched anything on blue ray yet but if there are any problems I will make a note of it on this review.Overall I am very happy with the purchase and if you are careful you can get a great deal.  We paid under $500 for it and I don't think you can find a better lcd for that price.

Reviews.Title: 42 LG
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my son who is going to college and living in our 2nd home. I got this TV from Amozon at a great price with free shipping.The TV has a great picture right out of the box with no adjustments.

Reviews.Title: It was a long search and this seems to be a winner
Reviews.Author: Amazonist "Hapusan"
Reviews.Content: Owned less than a month but having no trouble learning to use with Sat. TV and DVR. The delivery was joy! The young man brought the package into the house, opened it and set up the new after removing the the old and very heavy set. He assembled the new set and checked that it operated correctly and left with all the bulky packaging. At 91 with bad back I felt like a king!! Hope the TV lives up to its start

Reviews.Title: Had this 3 months now...
Reviews.Author: gjirel "gj777"
Reviews.Content: ...and it's very good. It's my first HD TV and no problems what so ever so far, would very much recommend it.I use it for gaming mostly, some film viewing and a little TV. (be warned gamers: if you are coming from a smaller screen to this size, you'll see graphical flaws that you'd miss on a smaller scale - pixelation ahoy! But of course there's no way I'd go back;)I agree with some of the cons posted around that because there are only 2 hdmi ports (one at the side) it can be a limitation -but for me it's not an issue. If that is a deal breaker for you then take note.The other prominent complaint I heard before buying is the 'depth of the black' in the picture is not great, especially when veiwed off-centre (that it appears more 'lit' grey than black). Yes, I can see that some people would have a niggly issue with it, and I can imagine that the picture would not be as good from an elevated (high mounted) position or other odd angles. But I have it at a little above (seated) eye level, facing the centre and the picture is great-even the darker action scenes look black enough for me! So this could be another deal breaker-if you intend to mount it high up on the wall, maybe consider another model. For centred eye level, it's good!There's no motion blur as I have seen from other sets around this price, and honestly if you are expecting better picture overall then you are looking for the highest spec possible and will need to spend another 3-400 I think.The sound is also good, especially for hidden speakers. The 'AV' presets are good (optimised picture & sound for sports, cinema, etc) the power saver option as well as all the customisable picture possibilities mean that you can adjust things to suit your viewing style.To sum up very happy with this machine, it is a great first HD flat screen. If it had an accident tomorrow, I'd replace it with the same model.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Hman
Reviews.Content: I think people can get lost in all the reviews and hype.  I was looking for a LCD for my game room for the kids to play their Wii and Xbox.  This could not be ANY better.  Great picture ,sound is great.  Kids love it.  EASY set up (from a 40 year old is not tech savy).  Hardest part was the 5 minutes putting the stand together since I was by myself, but again, no big deal.My only advice, pay the extra few dollars and stock up on some HDMI cables from Amazaon.  I had to rush out to Best Buy and the cheapest was $27.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: OHA
Reviews.Content: I have bought this TV over a month ago and have been thoroughly impressed by it. The picture quality is easily comparable to any Sony or Samsung LCD TV I have seen. I have watched both Blu-rays and HD-DVDs and they look great! The HD tuner works great and has a nice on-screen display that displays the start and end times of a TV program as well as a short synopsis. The setup menu is very clean and intuitive, which is a big plus. The TV also offers a quick on-the-fly menu which allows for easy access to the aspect ratio and audio settings. I really appreciate that the TV has a "Just Scan" aspect ratio setting that shows the entire video; this means that I can see all of my 1080p input instead of a cropped and slightly zoomed in version that most TV's will display. Finally, I really like that connected (and active) inputs are moved to the front of the input list, making it much quicker to switch to them. Overall, I am very satisfied with this LG TV.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews about this TV and finally decided to go with it since the Black Friday price on LG televisions was great.  I installed it immediately after receiving it.  This tv was put into the family room.  Since setting it up my wife, daughter and I have watched this TV more than my 52" Sony in the gameroom that I bought last Black Friday.  I have to say it was a better tv than I thought.  And at $500, it was a terrific deal.  I did purchase the LG mount as well which was a little more than I wanted to pay but I am glad I did.  They both work well together.  I have only been using it for a month but so far have been very satisfied with this purchase.  I would definitely recommend this to someone else especially if you can get it on sale!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the money but...
Reviews.Author: HitoV
Reviews.Content: The unit that I received seemed used. The packaging was pretty banged up and there were scuff marks and small scratches all over the TV. (thankfully none on the screen.) I am still giving it a 4 star because it works wonderfully and the quality is excellent for the money. The fault lies more on Amazon or UPS than it does LG so I will not dock stars for their wrong doing.On to the review of the TV:If you are picky about blacks this TV is probably not for you as they do seem much grayer then my other TV (Higher end LG). With some tweaking you can get it to look decent but don't expect higher end Samsung quality blacks. If you have no idea what I am talking about then this TV is probably for you as you wont even notice... like my parents :p (They are VERY happy with it.)A quick positive summary I can give is that the price/quality ratio is probably one of the best you will get out there. The pictures are crisp and with some tweaking nice and vibrant. 120-240hz is extremely overrated in my opinion, i thought it was awesome at first but now I just keep it off on my TV. (So do not worry about getting a 60hz.... its fine!) The remote and the menus are easy to use and there is even a quick options menu if you want to change your color profile or aspect ratio on the fly.Do yourself a favor and try to tweak the picture to your liking on one of the "expert" profiles. You may be surprised how much better picture quality you can get out of it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, even better service.
Reviews.Author: PensGal
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for a great price. Amazon beat out all other competitors on the price of this particular TV. But what I'd really like to talk about is the customer service. I ordered this TV 3 days before Thanksgiving and I got it the day before Thanksgiving. I was absolutely thrilled about the speed of shipping (which was free) but I was devastated when I opened the box and saw that the frame around the TV was shattered and falling apart. I've had to return things that I've bought online before and I was dreading it. Imagine my relief when Amazon offered to send me out a new TV immediately (which ended up getting there the day after Thanksgiving) and also arranged for UPS to pick up the broken TV at my house. I've dealt with other companies before who had completely soured me on purchasing from them because of the hassle of returning or exchanging products that I had purchased online, but Amazon treated me wonderfully. For the price of the TV and the service you get? You can't beat Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Riner "scrapper312"
Reviews.Content: We love this TV, the HD is awesome. We didn't know what we were missing. Haven't found anything we don't like about this TV. Great price. THANKS Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Needed new system board first day
Reviews.Author: Micah
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on Black Friday.  Arrived the following Tuesday.  Looked great right out of the box.  Unfortunantly after watching TV for 15 minutes the television wouldn't turn back on.  Rather than exchange the tv through Amazon I contacted LG customer support and they arranged for the tv to be repaired.  Thankfully there was an LG repair location right in my town which replaced a deffective system board.  TV works great now. Love the picture, price, and look of this tv.  I purchased it through Amazon as they offered the lowest price, free shipping, and no sales tax. I hope it is problem free from here on out.

Reviews.Title: "Highly Recommended"
Reviews.Author: Thursday Trader
Reviews.Content: We purchased the LG 42LD450 television from Amazon and it arrived quickly and in perfect condition.  Setup was easy.The 1080p 60 Hz picture quality is bright, blur-free, and wonderful -- especially while watching content that is in HD.The sound quality is excellent and loud, and even better if you select "Infinite Sound" (Surround Sound) under AUDIO OPTIONS.  However, if you want window-shaking booming bass sound, you can optionally connect this TV to exterior speakers.The TV is well worth the retail price. If you are able to purchase it for anything less than retail, you are getting tremendous value for the price.For the highest video play quality, you'll want to connect your dvd or blu ray player using an HDMI cable. HDMI cables are pretty much generic but many are priced at $20 and up.  However, Amazon sells a 6.5 foot HDMI cable for under $10: the AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable. I bought the AmazonBasics HDMI cable and it works great!

Reviews.Title: Great deal for brand and quality
Reviews.Author: mizzrizz "mizzrizz"
Reviews.Content: Okay.. I'm not an electronics nut or aficionado and up until now, I had a 27" TV with a tube.. so take that into the context of my review. I love this TV.... everything is so sharp and clear. Stand set up was super easy and then it was pretty much plug and play. Only minor complaint is that it only has one HDMI cable in port. Other than that, $549 free shipping and no tax for a top of the line brand 42".. can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Beyond pleased!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: I've been holding off buying a HDTV for years now because I just couldn't make myself spend what I considered to be an outlandish amount of money on one.  I was doing some scouting for Black Friday on Wednesday when I ran across this TV and I couldn't believe my luck.  It was about $25 more than the similar Black Friday offering at Target, but it was available now and I wouldn't have to try my luck at five in the morning.  That's more than worth $25 to me!  It arrived yesterday and it was a breeze to set up and I was watching TV within 30 minutes of taking it out of the box.  I was also lucky that my TIVO Premiere came with an HDMI cable because I did not order one with the TV.  The picture is fantastic and the TV is very user friendly.  I've never had such an easy setup for any new gadget in my house!  This really was a steal and I'm truly patting myself on the back especially now that the price has gone back up slightly!

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the money
Reviews.Author: Lucky Bo in Arkansas
Reviews.Content: Purchased as an early Christmas present (for myself), I was attracted to the price.  I had some reservation about the slower 60 hz refresh rate, however, I cannot see any difference.  I do wish it had a 3rd HDMI slot, but at this price I can live with just two.Easy to program, nice picture and low price = satisfied me.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a wonderful price
Reviews.Author: Rojotepe "Rojotepe"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv when it was $500. It was a great value. It looks great. It sounds good. The picture quality is super. I'd like to buy a second one. My only complaint has to do with the delivery company. At first, they didn't want to reschedule the delivery time even though I called the company to change the time. The problem was solved after many phone calls and the delivery guy installed the tv in less than 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Incredible purchase!
Reviews.Author: J. Rogers
Reviews.Content: After much online and in store reviewing, I purchased this tv as a gift for my mother. She loved it! It looked perfect in her new living room. It has a fantastic clear picture (thanks to my adding an HDMI cable). This makes it amazingly clear. Just be sure to get the right size for your room. These tv s seem to look better the further away you are from it. In retrospect, I should have gotten a smaller tv for this particular room. But thats my human error, no fault of the tv. Its gorgeous. Enjoy!PSI liked the LG so much, I bought 2 22 inch tvs for use as computer monitors!! Love those as well.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Image and Great Price
Reviews.Author: k. stanislav
Reviews.Content: This is a great value and a great TV.  I am very pleased with the picture, sound, controls...pretty much everything about it.  I highly suggest this TV if you are looking for an HD LCD 42" unit.

Reviews.Title: exceptional TV
Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a gift for my son and daughter-in-law. They love it! The picture is extremely clear, there is no glare on the screen and the set-up was done by my son with no problem. I am very satisfied that they are happy.The only problem I had was with the delivery carrier. There was an option offered when ordering, that I chose, to have the carrier call me to set up a day and approximate time to deliver, so that there would be someone home to accept. There were several attempts made by the carrier to deliver, but they couldn't because they never contacted me first. After several phone calls to Amazon & the carrier, it was finally delivered.In spite of the delivery problems, I would definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Value for Money
Reviews.Author: syam
Reviews.Content: I always purchase products when they become cheaper and create lot of value.By far, this is best purchase i made in that sense.  Amazon Price of 499$ was lower than all other sites i searched. Combining that with free Tivo DVR with this purchase, i was very happy.Sound Quality: This is my first HDTV. But, comparing with my friend's TV (Sony Bravia series or Samsund LED TV), i didn't see any difference.Picture Quality: Picture was perfect. I tried all 3 options (Cinema, Sports etc). They work perfect.Other Options: HDMI connection with laptop/DVD/Blu-ray worked just fine. No issues.USB Option says only Picture/Photos mode. But, there is hack available with which you can watch movies from External/Portable Hard Disk.You can get Wi-Fi LG Netcast features by buying LG Wi-fi adapater for 40$. That will get you all internet applications like Netflix/ Amazon VOD / Hulu etc.You can count on this TV as your best purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Christopher Flouton "SLSP20910"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as an upgrade to an Olevia 37" 720p flat screen TV that was purchased in 2006. Wanted full 1080p since I own an LG Blu-ray player. I paid $200 less for this new LG than I did for my old Olevia. And the picture quality is beautiful. Set up was simple. And it weighs 30 pounds less than my old LCD TV, so it was easier to install alone. Bottom line, beautiful TV, GREAT price, good features and good picture quality. So, if you have been waiting (like I was) to go bigger and better, wait no longer.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: This is my second LCD tv, but my first large screen.  I just had trouble trying to justify spending over a grand or more on a tv when I have other projects around the house I should be throwing money at.  The first one I've had for a couple years, 19" Magnavox I used as a monitor, and Xbox games & Netflix (now its just a monitor).I also found this for $658.00, which was low enough for my to rationalize the purchase and not feel guilty.  I'm very happy with the picture and the number of hookups.  You'll be able to run everything through this tv, the only reason I don't have my desktop through it is location.  It doesn't have all the latest and greatest web features, but I think it's a quality 1080p HD picture, which is really what I was looking for.If you're real techy, or visual-phile, then this probably isn't for you, but for the average viewer/user, it's hard to beat the picture for the price.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Bailey Stein
Reviews.Content: We had gotten this for a Christmas Gift and WOW! HD is awesome! The TV itself is amazing. We got this during Black Friday so we got a really good deal. The Picture Quality is great, you will not be dissapointed with 60Hz over 120Hz. That was our #1 Concern. No problems at all. The sound is good. The TV can read USB Flash Drives which makes a really nice feature. Also, the setup was really easy. The TV has a built-in manual for crying out loud. It was a great desicion. 100% Satisfied. Best TV owned! (So Far)

Reviews.Title: Best purchase for the money
Reviews.Author: threehangers
Reviews.Content: I had limited funds and was searching for a good quality flat screen tv when my old 39" Panasonic bit the dust.  My daughter has this same Lg TV and had paid much more for it.  I found a really good deal on Amazon and that came at the right time.  So far I love it.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: K. Culton "Nanakay"
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome flatscreen television.  I bought it as a gift for my husband and he loves it so far.  We have no complaints as of yet.  the picture is awesome, the sound is amazing and I would recommend it if you are thinking about buying it.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I was on a budget with this tv and this is the best price for a tv with these specs. I got free 2 day shipping from amazon prime and they sent it fedex it got here in two days with only a conor of the box a little cut/dented. the tv and everything in the box was fine. In all a beautful tv and amazon had the best price.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Z. Goodman
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my mother as a christmas gift this year, and I'm very pleased with it. Contrary to some reviews I read, the viewing angle is fine. The color stays great even at extreme angles. I upgraded from a 25" tv from 1985 and the picture quality is astronomical by comparison.The only complaint I can give is with this tv I also ordered a logitech 5.1 audio system to connect it to, but I soon found out that this tv isn't perfectly compatible with 5.1 audio systems, because it lacks the right connections, so I had to run the cables through the headphone connection, which I don't think is the correct way to do it, but happens to be the only possible way to do it, due to this tv's connections.Overall, for the price (I paid $500.00) this tv is unbeatable. It's an outstanding deal, and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: LG 42 INCH HDTV
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at the picture quality.  The picture quality can be compared to some LED LCD's.  Great bang for the buck, I only paid $478.00.  Used with games on PS3 and still amazed at the picture quality.  I wished that it had a separate output for audio, but you can use the output to the headphones, along with an adapter, to route the audio to your receiver.

Reviews.Title: geat value
Reviews.Author: emeraldsea
Reviews.Content: I paid 470.00 for this 42" TV and even though it doesn't have all of the bells and whistles of the latest fully loaded TV's it is an excellent value, great picture for the money.I have no complaints and it came within 5 days.

Reviews.Title: First HD
Reviews.Author: nova
Reviews.Content: This is my first HD TV and I am very pleased. The quick start instructions are minimalist and leave much to be desired - they don't mention that you must select your input. My bad - I assumed the TV would automatically go to what I thought was the main input, HDMI 1. This resulted in considerable frustration initially when it did not. Nor did it help that the real instruction manual was on CD and I needed to access it from a computer.Overall, as stated before I am very pleased with the performance of the LG HDTV now that I have figured out what to do. We enjoy the clarity on sports, TV, and movies. Now we wonder why we didn't get an HDTV earlier.

Reviews.Title: tv
Reviews.Author: sueski
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the tv"s picture and the price that we paid. Delivery was quick and was better than having to leave the house to get it.

Reviews.Title: LG 42" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: RLR
Reviews.Content: So far we're very happy with this TV.  Stores had similar for a few dollars less, but with sales tax and "recycling fee" it was actually cheaper to buy it from Amazon - and have it delivered right to my door! Didn't have to fight the Christmas shopping crowds and schlepp it home.  Only negative so far is that it doesn't have a standard audio out connection.  Otherwise, great.  It was easy to set up, has a great picture, and the controls are intuitive and easy to figure out without digging into the manual.  Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: HerbieHusker
Reviews.Content: Impressed with TV. No real complaints at all. Great picture quality. I don't see that it's necessary to get 120 hz for the extra money, particularly when it is only better for high action, like sports. Some may prefer 3 hdmi ports rather than the 2 on this product, but you can purchase a splitter for a small amount. My only tiny complaint is that I think the power light on the bottom right breaks up on the sleek design.

Reviews.Title: LG LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Deacon
Reviews.Content: We love it!  We received our LG two days after we were notified that it was shipped.  It was in great condition and is working beautifully.  The price was very reasonable and we are very satisfied with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy from Amazon on an LG 42" LCD
Reviews.Author: kc9lbu
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best deal out there. This TV outperforms some of the 120Hz TV's. 100,000:1 contrast is awesome! Ease of OSD and remote is great. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be better
Reviews.Author: ckjk
Reviews.Content: We love every aspect of this TV. After reading about LCD's not having the clarity of plasma and having a limited viewing angle, we just don't know what the reviewers are talking about. The TV is great!

Reviews.Title: LG 42"
Reviews.Author: BC "BC"
Reviews.Content: Picture is clear and sharp.  Sound is nothing extraordinary and the volume could be a little stronger, but the ability to enhance the voice range over the background is nice.  Inputs are good, but some people will want more than the 2 HDMI inputs.  Overall a very good television, especially at the sale price that was on it during Black Friday.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Amazing Price
Reviews.Author: Lynn Ward
Reviews.Content: We purchased the set from Amazon in late November.  The price was $499 with free shipping and no sales tax.  We able to get another $10 off by opening an Amazon credit card, which included an option to finance interest free for 24 months.  The set was delivered to my front door within the week, and I made the first $20 monthly payment last week.  How's that for a pain free purchase?Our main set is a 55" Samsung 120 Hz LED TV, which has an amazing picture quality, so we were expecting to be underwhelmed by the LG.  But the picture on the LG is really terrific.  Colors are brilliant and the image is very sharp.  The sound quality is actually better than the Samsung, but my understanding is that none of the flat screen sets can compare to projection and CRT's when it comes to sound quality.  It's easy enough to attach a sound bar if you care about such things.Overall, I don't think you can do better for the price.

Reviews.Title: LG Does make Life Good
Reviews.Author: KittyL
Reviews.Content: This Television has gotten only great comments from people coming to my home.  It has great picture clarity and the sound is fabulous.  For my situation it looks as though it belongs in my Living Room. Great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Patrick S
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I'm horrified by the shipping Amazon used.  On this site, Amazon claims to use a special carrier (CEVA, Pilot or Home Direct) on T.V.s over 40 inches, and that this company will call you when they are ready to deliver it, so you can tell them when to come over.  My 42 inch TV shipped FedEx and they left it on the steps when it was 0 degrees outside.  It was pure chance that my brother noticed it while driving away, otherwise it would have been left outside the entire day, or until someone came by and said, "Oh, look.  A free TV!"Now that that is out of the way, I am greatly pleased with my TVs performance.  I mainly use the TV for over the air broadcasts, playing XBOX 360, and watching video from my computer.  The picture looks wonderful on HD broadcasts, and SD looks pretty good too.  One thing I love is the Cinema Zoom setting allows you to zoom in to over a dozen levels and move the picture up and down as much as you would want.  This is really helpful if a station is broadcasting shows in 4:3 letterbox, instead of 16:9.The channels change really quick, and gives several lines of text about the current show or movie, and the next broadcast on the same channel, which makes it really easy to tell what's on.I am very happy with my TV, which I got for under $500, and I think anyone would be happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Joxer
Reviews.Content: Other than Fedex knocking only once and leaving this at my front door, The TV and my Order are perfect. I'v only been watching NetFlix through Wii with component cables so far, so havn't made use of the 1080p. Getting Dish with HD and HD DVR soon. as well as a blu-ray player. Will be able to comment on HI-Def then. Iv had a Vizio 42 inch 1080p before. The color, contrast, audio, and ease of use do not compare to this LG. I suspect I will have no issues to speak of when I get to make full use of the 1080p view.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Bob Carroll
Reviews.Content: This TV looks beautiful in my bedroom.  I love the 42" 1080 high def picture.  It puts 57 inch projection TV I have in another room in the house to shame.  All in all I would definitely recommend this TV for the price of $499.99.  I shopped around and this is by far the best deal.

Reviews.Title: The Most User Friendly TV I've Ever Owned!
Reviews.Author: Richard Olmstead
Reviews.Content: This TV is so user friendly.  The input pictures and menu pictures make it extremely easy to navigate around.  This TV also looks very sharp.  I like how the back is setup.  I have it hanging on the wall in my garage on a Cheetah swivel mount.  This was the first LG product I've ever owned and I am quite impressed.  It is a step up from Vizio and way better than the crappy Westenhouse I own.  In fact, I just bought an LG Blu-ray player to go along with it and that is great too.  And I also bought a 32" LG for a christmas present.  You can't go wrong with this tv.  It has a great picture and is also very lightweight.  Amazon also had a courier service come bring it in, unpack, and set it up mounting it on my bracket for me.  They paid for all that with the free shipping I got with the TV.  I love Amazon and I love this TV.  And its about time somebody gave Walmart some competition.  More and more of my business is going to Amazon and away from traditional Brick & Mortars (B&M;).

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: willsnana "willsnana"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy my kids a new tv for Christmas at a reasonable price and this was it.  Got it on Black Friday for a better price than local stores.  The product came out of the box with a beautiful picture, with little adjustment.  For an entry level set, I was pleasantly surpised.If you're looking for a nice set at a good price, you will enjoy the results.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: J. Roland
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd TV ordered from Amazon.  First one was TLC, great price, but had screen problems and "black outs" with HDMI cable use.  Replaced with same TV and it did the same thing, so finally ordered this one.  Great TV for the price.  Hooked up in minutes, works great with HDMI from cable box.  Able to use universal remote from Time Warner.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV. Solid value.
Reviews.Author: CommonSense
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a replacement for an older playroom television. I needed something that offered good quality and ease of use/setup, etc at a reasonable price. (This is a playroom TV, not our "main" living-room television so I wasn't looking for 120 Hz., LED, internet-ready, etc.) There are enough of various connections/inputs to do what we need and hook up what's necessary. I've got the HD cable box going in via HDMI, Wii is in via standard RCA's as is an older DVD/VCR combo. I'll add an xbox 360 soon to the other HDMI. I've had the TV for about a week and we're very pleased. It's a good purchase and a good value.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, horrible shipping
Reviews.Author: princess32931
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my recent purchase but I would like to warn anyone buying this TV or any other, that FedEx will just leave it on your door. I really don't see the logic in leaving a TV on someone's doorstep without knowing if they are home. Anyone could have just stolen it from my doorstep!

Reviews.Title: Worth the wait...
Reviews.Author: K. Best "Picture Junkie"
Reviews.Content: Our Sony console TV was finally going bad after almost 20 years!  We replaced it with this TV.  This TV was easy to set up, the menus were easy to use, and the remote is very user-friendly as well.  We looked at several TV's for about 6 weeks before this purchase and after comparing the TV's and prices - this was the one for us!  We are setting up HD soon...and looking forward to even better viewing!  Thanks, Amazon, for a great deal on a great TV!

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier with this tv
Reviews.Author: adt911
Reviews.Content: I had been waiting for a long time to purchase a new tv, and with the great deal at amazon I finally pulled the trigger.[...]The picture is great for what I would ever need to watch. I do watch sports and they look great to me, no blurring or ghosting. I find myself watching things I never would before just to see the great picture quality.  I have dish network with HD programming and the standard definition channels do not look the best but you can change the settings around to help with that.Great deal, great tv.  I would highly recommend this tv for the budget minded consumer.  It only has two HDMI inputs but I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: What a D-E-A-L on the LG 42" LCD HDTV 64hz 1080p TV!!
Reviews.Author: Cc123
Reviews.Content: We have had the TV for about 10 days and so far I can do nothing but sing its praise! Picture is crystal clear and everything works just as it should! Football is great to watch on it! I got a great deal on it a couple of days before Thanksgiving for $499, signed up for Prime, so no shipping and NO tax! No tax is a biggie here in TN where sales tax alone would have been arouund $50+! This is the same as Wal Mart with no battling the Black Friday crowd plus after my Amazon GC's from Swagbucks.....better than Wally's price!Very simple to put together....the hubs had it playing in less than 15 minutes. Bottom line....great TV, great price and so glad we did!!

Reviews.Title: For gamers only
Reviews.Author: Eddie Guzman
Reviews.Content: being that the tv only has a 60HZ refresh rate it causes a lot of motion blur for anything running at 24fps like movies or tv shows when the on screen movement becomes a little too hectic.  The stand is a little wobbly and has been making me paranoid that someone will brush up against it and knock it to the ground. Once you get past this the set has a great picture quality and has made my games which run at 30fps and 60fps look amazing.  I definitely recommend this for gamers but not for people who want this for high def movie watching

Reviews.Title: DEAD after 1 year
Reviews.Author: amashopper
Reviews.Content: Amazon did a great job of fulfilling the order just before Christmas 2010, the TV looked great, it sounded great, and performed flawlessly, until it popped and died two days ago.  It was a couple months out of warrantee, of course.  It seems as though the power supply has gone bad.  I'm going to attempt a fix but I suspect I'll be money ahead by just throwing it (and the $500 I spent on it) in the trash.  Don't throw your money away too.  Buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!!
Reviews.Author: Michael Moers
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV now for over 6 months, and it is incredible.  I watch a lot of sports and movies, and the picture is always GREAT, no matter what time of day or what kind of lighting is available.  It was well worth the price, and I am now a big fan of LG products.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal, Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: D37Mark
Reviews.Content: I was amazed when I put a Blue-Ray into my PS3 and played it on this TV, both sound and picture are absolutely great. I also play Call of Duty frequently and was worried that the 60hz would affect gaming - being very blurry when you turn fast, but it doesn't I do not notice any blurs or anything else. I bought this when it was $500 and I do not regret the purchase at all.

Reviews.Title: My first HDTV
Reviews.Author: quickster
Reviews.Content: I bought this model from a local Walmart about 9 months ago. Its an awesome TV. You will need a separate means for audio since this model is not an exception to the crap sound quality of just about every flatscreen tv out there. I'd buy this tv again though. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: one of the greatest TV's
Reviews.Author: thomas
Reviews.Content: Ive owned this TV since about feburary of 2011. the HD Quality is Breath taking. the only complaint I have with this TV is that it only has 2 HDMI inputs. Movies on this TV make you feel like your in a movie theater. If your looking for a TV, Get this one

Reviews.Title: Love this tv
Reviews.Author: celebrate
Reviews.Content: We did extensive research before purchasing this TV. It is amazing! Everything has worked great. We did add an inexpensive surround sound system and we are blown away every time we turn it on.The price we paid on Amazon was also amazing. We went local with the price but they could not even match it.  Very pleased with our purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, sound is garbage
Reviews.Author: Dave B.
Reviews.Content: I bought this LG at Leon's in Canada, and wasn't disappointed with the spectacular 1080p picture. No tearing, the colour is very vibrant, and lots of picture settings make it great for any video enthusiast. However, the speakers on this T.V. are among the worst I've ever heard (on a T.V. or no). The speakers on a cell phone would be preferable to the trash put into the back of the unit. It echoes off your wall, so it will sound like you're listening to headphones played from a tinny bucket. If you are looking to get a full package, pick up a set of external speakers with your T.V., and you will enjoy excellent picture and sound quality.

Reviews.Title: It is a great tv.
Reviews.Author: critique
Reviews.Content: I will make it very short and simple. I work for a satellite company and have a good picture of what a good tv is. This one is great because of its price, size, design, sound, black depth, responsiveness, and menu features. I am in love with this panel.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: missylissac
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 6 months now.  It was a Christmas gift from my dad Christmas 2010.  We were able to get in on an unbelievable deal ($478).  The picture quality is great, sound is great, everything is great.  We upgraded from a 15 year old tube TV, so this was our first flat screen.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV
Reviews.Author: keeb
Reviews.Content: I have the tv hooked up to my receiver, so I have no idea how the sound is for the tv by itself.  I've not had any issues with the picture quality or anything.  It is a 60hz tv, so some sports games can be a bit fuzzy for a second or two every once in a while.  Overall I am happy with the purchase.I have it hooked up with a blu-ray player and also connect my pc to, both through my receiver(Sony).  Everything looks great on it, and there is no image residue when using my pc(my 720p tv always has that residue).  Watched Avatar in blu-ray on it and was simply amazed at how great the picture was, and had no fuzzy picture through the movie!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: Dave P
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV on 2/21/11, delivered thru "Pilot", but via a 3rd party (some 25 year old kid with a delivery truck that only had my TV on it...).  They weren't supposed to deliver it "up the stairs" (2nd floor apartment), but he offered anyway.  He helped me remove it from the packaging it to inspect for damage, but because it was so cold, he suggest that I wait a little while to turn it on.  I assembled the stand (still not sure what one of the pieces is for though... maybe a cover for when it's wall-mounted?) then after half an hour or so turned it on and WOW, what a difference.  I mean, I went from a CRT to this, which will be a huge difference, but still, my brother has a 32" 720p RCA that looks terrible next to this.  I'm obviously not a huge videophile, BUT this IS 1080p and I'm not sure the average person is going to notice a huge difference in refresh rate from 60Hz to 120Hz...I wasn't looking for top-of-the-line because I didn't want to spend a TON of money.  I got this for around $550-600, hooked up my XBOX 360 Slim via HDMI and my PC via VGA and the picture on both is great.Navigating menus on this TV is very easy and I the aspect ratio for both the PC and the 360 look fine.  The aesthetics of the TV are nice too - typical LG blue/red power indicator light and the gloss black finish on it is beautiful.No problems thus far (still none - 5/11/11), but I'll be sure to report back if I do have any.Another update.  It's 12/27/2012 now (almost 2 years gone out of the 3 year Squaretrade warranty I bought) and I still have no problems to report with this TV.  All of my inputs still work.  The HD picture is still great - I'm not a huge videophile so maybe I don't notice small fades in dark areas or whatever, but for your average viewer, it's still beautiful.  I highly recommend LG for quality.  Just bought Emerson 32" and Sharp 46" on sale at other retailers for my gf's parents... we'll see how they hold up.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for buck but doesn't compare to my Samsung
Reviews.Author: PuffDr4gon
Reviews.Content: I brought this TV in January when Amazon was holding the "Big TVs, small prices" deal, I forget the actual promo they were going by, but I believe it was close to that. Anyway, I wanted another HD set to put in my bedroom. I have a Samsung that was in the same price range, size and with just about the same amount of connections and features. I bought this thinking it'd be comparative to the Samsung and since I like the Samsung a lot, I thought I would like this one the same. Well, that's mostly true except for the quality of the picture. My Samsung, as well as this one are both 1080p with 60hz refresh. This set is just not as crisp as my Samsung. I love watching hockey and can definitely see the difference (blur/lag) between this set and my Samsung during faster movements. It's irritating but not to the point I would go through the hassle of returning it. For the price range I bought it at I am pleased, but was hoping for a better picture.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: Sqrmster
Reviews.Content: This was my first "grown up TV" purchase. It's absolutely stunning and perfect! It makes my whole room look bigger.I sat it on top of my 30" tall/50" wide stand and it's the exact perfect size to watch from my bed. The picture is great and I LOVE how the volume control looks (a little circle in the bottom right corner that turns the ascending numbers clockwise like a wheel instead of going across the screen from left to right. I know that may not be significant, but it makes it seem fancier!)It's easy to use, instructions seem clear.Delivery was hassle-free, I was able to call and leave instruction for them to call my apt manager for him to let them in to my apt (so it wasn't left at the front door) and everything went smoothly!My only problem is the mute button stopped working almost immediately. I think I read that I just need to replace the batteries, but it may be a whole system reset which is annoying. I bought this TV in January 2011 - it's March 2011 now, so if anything negative happens soon I will edit this review.Otherwise, amazing! I love it and am extremely happy with my purchase.Side note: I also purchased the SquareTrade 3 Year Warranty (was a little nervous because it seemed like a scam) but it was actually legit, I received an email and a phone call from the company which really reassured me.No one can believe what a great deal I got (I see it's more expensive now- I got lucky and purchased it at $499) But I still highly recommend this!!UPDATE: I know this TV is currently showing as "unavailable" on Amazon, but for any of you just searching reviews of this particular one- I'm approaching 2 years and ZERO complaints! I got AT&T; Uverse and a new remote control which fixed the "mute" button not working. The picture looks amazing- it's never flickered or had any issues with hours of daily use :) I love to just keep it on because the picture looks and sounds so nice. I know there are newer models compared to this, but it's still a really nice looking tv and I would buy it all over again for the living room!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: ilea
Reviews.Content: Very nice tv for the price. Easy to set up. Stand slides into the tv 4 screws and you're done. Straight out of the box the picture was a little dodgey but once I ran the picture wizard everything looks awesome. Now I need another one to replace my other tube tv... come on tax return!

Reviews.Title: 42 in LG
Reviews.Author: N. Wall
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the 42 in LG TV I just bought on Amazon. Could not beat the price and no delivery fee. Very good picture too. Thx Amazon

Reviews.Title: LG 42" 1080p
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Very easy to hook up and also easy to set picture, sound etc... For the price I would recommend to anyone, what a great deal and hopefully will enjoy for years to come!

Reviews.Title: Great Tv!!!
Reviews.Author: Dolceman81
Reviews.Content: Tv is great! For the price $500 flat, I couldn't be happier! Best buy and other stores are selling this tv for $600. I would recommend if you are looking for a entry lcd tv. Pic quality is great! Amazon price was the lowest even cheaper than Walmart so I know I got a good deal!

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect - Just one annoying thing
Reviews.Author: TJhawk
Reviews.Content: This TV has awesome picture and sound quality.  It looks great and I love to watch games and movies on it.  The only thing I have an issue about is it turns itself off and then back on randomly sometimes.  Maybe 5-10 times a week I will be watching something and then it shuts off for a few seconds before turning back on.  It has yet to happen in an important part of a game I'm watching or movie but I feel its bound to.  I contacted LG and they acted like this never happens.  Google it and you will see its pretty common.  I'm still trying to work on a fix for this, probably should have returned it when I first noticed it happenening, now I'm stuck with it.  Like I said though otherwise it's an awesome TV for the price.. buyer be wary

Reviews.Title: I like it...I like it ALOT!
Reviews.Author: billm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought ourselves a reasonably-priced, last minute Christmas present. I ordered the LG 42LD450 42-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV one day and it was delivered the next. No, we don't work for Amazon.com or live near a distribution center. Just fast service! Our 14-year old granddaughter and her 17-year old brother unboxed it and assembled the base and hooked it up to our satellite service. We didn't read any directions - it's that simple. We had a picture up and running within about ten minutes. The picture is beautiful and the sound is great. I had read in the reviews that the sound was not that good and a home theater package can't be added. Our son dropped by and (unpromted) commented on how good the sound was. We've watched more TV than we have in quite awhile - especially movies. We had never seen John Wayne's "True Grit." We chose it as our first movie to watch on the new TV. As we watched, we stopped the picture and marveled over the "paintings" on the screen. I recommend this product highly and know you will like it - you will like it ALOT.  LG 42LD450 42-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Christopher Keenan
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV on Black Friday after not seeing the 120hz unit go on sale. I thought I can't comment on the 120hz as I didn't see it, but I love this unit. It's colors are super bright and vibrant. I upgraded from an old 32 inch standard def tube tv so I may be biased having made the leap into HD. My only gripes are the fact that it only has 1 HDMI and 1 Component Cable input. I had to buy a spliter box for component cables so I could feed my Xbox 360, Wii, and PS2 into it and just one set of wires into the TV. Still, small price to pay for the exceptional value.Some folks note that the audio is not good on this tv. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great once it got here
Reviews.Author: BumpinBuick
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for a Christmas/Birthday gift. Unfortunately the first one was stolen by a UPS employee. Fortunately Amazon was kind enough to send a second even though it missed the holidays. It seems to be a great buy considering the cost, the picture is great for an LCD, easy setup, very good product.The only cons are the stand is a bit flimsy, the slightest touch to the TV and it wiggles for awhile. The second is that there is no code to sync up a DirecTV remote with this TV. And finally there are a very limited amount of connections on the back, particularly lacking outputs. No way to output sound to an older system without an optical audio connection.

Reviews.Title: 42" 1080p for $500? wha-wha-what?!
Reviews.Author: Colin Hutchings "Big Tuna"
Reviews.Content: A few scathing reviews almost deterred me from purchasing this tv, but I'm sure glad I didn't listen. Their critiques are akin to those I encountered while contemplating purchasing the kindle3 case w/light.  The light's not even! It strains my eyes! Glad I didn't listen to them either.I am a late arrival to the flat screen party.  My previous tv was a 10 year old 1080i (4:3 and no 720p support. NOT PS3 FRIENDLY) CRT. I loved the old dinosaur and drove it into the ground. When it came time to find a replacement, I was confronted with a dilemma: LCD is old technology. Plasma, DLP, CRT--dead yesterday. LED is great and all, but, honestly, it's the manufacturer's way of saying, 'Other technologies aren't cost effective to mass produce at the moment; we're sorry LCD is still here, but we're making it better!! :)'. Well, what do i do? I have to buy something!So I bought this.My rationale was that a better low-mid range TV doesn't exist, on paper, for the price. Also, the price is reasonable enough that I'm not making a major investment, but it will hold me over until the next breakthrough technology is available (OLED perhaps?), when I DO plan on spending some bucks.So far I've spent a month with this beauty, mostly playing ps3 and using playstation's netflix app. I can confirm that the stats and specs that may seem too-good-to-be-true on paper are at the moment projecting quite nicely from the other end of my room. If you are finding yourself in a similar situation this is the no brainer buy.------------------------------Edit (1 hr later):I forgot to mention, this set does have one major flaw, and that is with the standard definition upscaler.  This was not a deal breaker for me because I don't view much SD content, but it may bother other buyers more depending on their preferences.  For example, my nintendo wii's 480p signal was handled beautifully by my aforementioned 1080i tv (which was of comparable size), but looks well below average on this LG.  I do NOT recommend this TV for a wii enthusiast!Rather than dock the TV for bobbling the quality with wii content, I dock the wii for completely dropping the ball on HD content. I can't speak for other SD programming, but CAVEAT EMPTOR

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT TV AT AMAZING PRICE
Reviews.Author: M. TERRY
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS TV TO REPLACE A 15 YR OLD 35" RCA DINOSAUR. I RESEARCHED LCD TV'S FOR SEVERAL MONTHS HOPING TO GET A GREAT BUY AROUND XMAS.  I'M GLAD I WAITED.  JUST BEFORE XMAS I WAS SEARCHING AMAZON FOR A SONY, WHEN I SAW THEY HAD LG'S AT GREAT PRICES.  I BOUGHT A 26" 720P LG W/DVD BEFORE LAST XMAS FOR THE KIDS TO PLAY WII. Reviews.Content: Good TV for someone who did not know how to pick one. After many searches and research I found this TV. Even though I was apprehensive about making the purchase I am so happy I did. It has worked out just fine for us.

Reviews.Title: It Broke!
Reviews.Author: cdkcorvette7
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome purchase for the money. It doesn't have some of the bells and whistles that the newest tv's do like internet connectivity, but it's a great product. Off-axis viewing (from the side) is great and the picture quality is superb. Great buy.UPDATE: This TV stopped working all of the sudden after less than two months of use. The company I purchased this from (through amazon) was not helpful at all. I had to contact LG directly and had to hold their hand and walk them through getting someone out to repair the unit in less than the three to four weeks they told me I would have to wait.The problem with the unit ended up being a bad power supply. Google this model with power supply and you'll find that this is a pretty common issue. The product is great when it works, I don't have much use for a 42 inch paperweight though. The repair company should be back to install the new power supply sometime this week... Hopefully I won't have to deal with this again. If the unit were more reliable this would be an easy four star product, maybe five given the bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Wow - much more than I was expecting
Reviews.Author: W. G. Upton "Husband, Father, Dork"
Reviews.Content: Got the 42LD450 mounted to the wall with a GSI Steel Articulating Arm Wall Mount, threw on an RCA ANT1050 for Over The Air signals, and I'm extremely impressed with this TV.  It's about 5' off the floor.  I tilted it down about 10 degrees, and even without turning the screen, I could not detect any loss of picture quality from any viewing position in the room (until you get to some really oblique angles in the corners).I ran the picture wizard to select what I considered to be the best picture, and I have absolutely no complaints about the screen or picture quality.  The blacks are deep.  Colors are vibrant.  Picture is sharp.I haven't explored it fully, but the only con I have is that it appears that the HDMI input and component input is either/or.  I'll update this review once I get my blu-ray and Satellite hooked up to those two inputs and see if they will both work.Other than that, I am perfectly happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J-Hog
Reviews.Content: I seen a previous poster say the picture is grainy, I dont see that at all.  Awesome picture and I am even more impressed by the colors.  I upgraded from a same size DLP I bought 4 years ago, and am very happy with the purchase. Reviews.Title: AMAZING ESPECIALLY FOR THE PRICE!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price

Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for our master bedroom to replace the 32" which we had there. I was really looking for a 52" for the basement but saw this one as great deal on a pre-Black Friday on Amazon.com.Now, to the features, picture quality - Great. Colors are very vibrant. Dvds look wonderful & Blu Rays look phenominal. Avatar is always my test Blu Ray - Love it.Sound quality - Surprisingly impressive. 20 watts total - the speakers have very good sound. Not a lot of bass, but what do you expect for TV speakers??? I don't have to turn the sound all the way up just hear a tv program. And with the AVL feature, I don't have to turn the speakers down everytime a commercial comes on.Menus - are Big & easy to read & very simple to follow. Pretty much pull out of the box & go.Cons - not a lot of HDMI ports, but I can't complain because it serves my purpose.Overall, this tv was a great buy @$499.97.We have a few LG products & have been pleased with the quality. This should be no different.

I highly recommend them, but stay away from LG Consumer Electronics.My father and customer of mine both have four plus year old Samsung's (my customer's is on all the time in their cafeteria). I feel the sound is adequate being that few flat screen tv's have immense sound from their speaker systems.  I also like the feature of bringing out the voice content from background noise. Reviews.Title: excellent

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV for Gaming and Computer Use
Reviews.Author: J. M. Bauer
Reviews.Content: This TV has an excellent response time and the number of available picture controls means you can really dial in the settings. The only drawback is the black levels. The deepest black this TV can get is decidedly gray. Thus, I would opt for a nice plasma screen if you are looking for a home theater centerpiece, but if you plan on using this with a gaming console and/or a computer, you really can't get much better for the price. I love this TV, but the LCD technology (poor black level performance) keeps it from being a truly great set. However, the color reproduction is surprisingly accurate (despite the poor black levels) and the picture is sharp and free from artifacts you often see in cheap LCD TVs. Considering the price I paid for it, I have no qualms about giving it a four stars.
